meanings.definition: To set or thrust in motion
meanings.sent2: She launched the boat into the water.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel launched itself from tree to tree, looking for nuts.
meanings.sent4: His speech launched a wave of excitement among the audience.
meanings.sent5: The car launched forward with a sudden burst of speed.

meanings.sent1: The company launched a new product line.
meanings.sent2: He launched his career in music with a hit single.
meanings.sent3: The magician launched into his act with a puff of smoke.
meanings.sent4: Her idea launched a series of innovative projects.
meanings.sent5: The teacher launched the lesson with an engaging story.

meanings.sent1: The ship launched a distress signal into the air.
meanings.sent2: The chef launched a new menu for the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The cat launched a playful attack on the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The volcano launched ash and smoke into the sky.
meanings.sent5: The singer launched her new album with a live performance.
